quotes.quote: 'Tis not enough your counsel still be true; Blunt truths more mischief than nice falsehoods do.
Justice and truth are too such subtle points that our tools are too blunt to touch them accurately.
One of the truest tests of integrity is its blunt refusal to be compromised.
Silence is the bluntest of blunt instruments.
He was always smoothing and polishing himself, and in the end he became blunt before he was sharp.
Downright admonition, as a rule, is too blunt for the recipient.
Praying without faith is like trying to cut with a blunt knife - much labor expended to little purpose.
The past is a life sentence, a blunt instrument aimed at tomorrow.
Words are blunt instruments, better suited to murder than to making sense of the world.
I believe if something needs to be said, people should say it. Blunt doesn't stab as deep as being cut by a secret.
Don't confuse being stimulating with being blunt.
Apart from blunt truth, our lives sink decadently amid the perfume of hints and suggestions.
How blunt are all the arrows of thy quiver in comparison with those of guilt.
The blunt truth about the politics of climate change is that no country will want to sacrifice its economy in order to meet this challenge.
Some tools of thought are so blunt that they are almost useless; others are so sharp that they are dangerous. But the wise man will have the use of both kinds.
A hot iron, though blunt, will pierce sooner than a cold one, though sharper
All means prove but a blunt instrument, if they have not behind them a living spirit.
To wrong those we hate is to add fuel to our hatred. Conversely, to treat an enemy with magnanimity is to blunt our hatred for him.
Cease negative mental chattering. If you think a thing is impossible, you'll make it impossible. Pessimism blunts the tools you need to succeed.
I have to say that anger is the blanket that comes around me, and that blunts and blurs my sense of proportion.
The knowledge that women lack stimulates their imagination; the knowledge that men possess blunts theirs.
Fill your bowl to the brim and it will spill. Keep sharpening your knife and it will blunt.
Time only blunts the pain of loss. It doesn’t erase it.
Kindness in ourselves is the honey that blunts the sting of unkindness in another.
A blunt statement can be as false as any other.
Blunt tools are sometimes found of use where sharper instruments would fail.
